column9: This is not a drug you should take while receieving methadone treatment it can put you in a state of mild stroke like symptoms I took 2 doses in two days for anxiety and it almost killed me I told my doctor I was on methadone and he gave me a prescription of 10 mg an it did not agree with me so be careful an always question any medication when taking different medications together because it can do serious harm to you

column2: LeeGStLMO, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have used Librium more times than I should have for alcohol withdrawal but I'm very alcoholic. This is the first time however that I have been prescribed Librium for high anxiety and depression after enitial treatment for alcohol cessation. It has always been Xanax or Valium. I personally compare 25 MG Librium to 1 MG Xanax or about like 10 MG Valium as for anxiety relief to be pretty much the same. But I believe the Librium has been longer lasting per dose for me and has (for the time at least) totally removed alcohol from my thoughts.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ok. First I was a Meth addict for about 3-4 years and the day I turned 21 I started drinking to stop doing Meth. I been drinking heavily for about 11 years now im 32 and finally decided ive had enough. I went to the doctor about a week ago and they prescribed me Librium. I think it works better than valium or xanax because ive had both in the past. drug is used to stop DTS but not to stop cravings only you can stop that. I give this drug 5 out of 5 stars...seriously if you really want to stop drinking you can but librium is only there to stop anxiety and the shakes.. good luck everyone and believe me there isnt a day i wake up and dont wanna get a 12 pack for breakfast.....only been sober for a week.. its really hard

column2: Tony Michael, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Good at anxiety control, but will not necessarily stop panic attacks.

column2: SharonMP50, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I took this medication as a child after having Encephalitis. I had horrible head aches and this is the only thing that worked. My doctors also felt that the headaches may be mild seizures as I had Grand Mal seizures with the Encephalitis. I wish my current doctor would give it to me now, the headaches are horrible and almost daily.

column2: cg489, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication has done wonders for me. I was coming off of alcohol and benzo's withdrawls and this helped alot.

column2: jay, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i have anxiety due to lyme desease related nerve damage.  this has been very effective without being intrusive or overwhelming. i have no side affects like i have had with many other anxiety treatments.

column2: betty, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was going threw a baaad break-up[man]i was sueing him going threw court homeless& very depressed they put me back on target& I kicked  his butt!

column2: hey, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: did not work

column2: WillMilano, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hi, in 2005 I was picked up and held in Jail for 9 days,then let go. while I was put into the remand, I started reacting with fear due to a type of Agoraphobia I have, which is stemmed from a control factor.  I was stuck in a cell(was in a wheelchair for spinal injury at the time), and they forced me to take I believe 25mg 3 times daily, so I would be calm and stop praying.  i had no control over my body and remember very little.  When released I was sent to the local emergency for an overdose treatment for Librium.  Since I have suffered severe night terrors, nervousness, phobia is much stronger with new ones connected....sever hair loss while on it/coming off, can't gain weight, ulcers, migraines, insomnia, full body aches.  I've been checked over up and down, and after a cancerous treatment, my doc tells me he doesn't know why or what.  I get severe panic attacks and loose my balance....its crazy....my life is very hard after that...I wasn't a drug user but now smoke pot to cope with all of this, which they recently re-criminalized.  I didn't want these drugs in my system, and holding me for 9 days for a couple of fines, while locking me in a concrete room in a wheelchair and drugging me up so I can't be human messes up my trust in humanity maybe....I started and run a foundation to help any of you who need help off prescription or street drugs......This is what this does to that % of people on Librium that they don't talk about.  I feel like my life is over and going to be like this forever, I'm only 32.

column1: Feeling of Apprehension Before an Operation

I would rather live happy and die early than be in living hell. I know the addictiveness will be there but that is what support is for right.

column9: i cant sleep

column2: anonymous, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i was prescribed this medication for narcotic withdrawl. It seems to work well as far as keeping me from crawling out of my skin. I was prescribed 25mg 3x daily but cannot function at all. I am sluggish and not at all able to work.

column2: abbey522, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 6 years of drinking every day, sometimes all day for days at a time, i went to the ER because I knew I was going to be sick and they gave me librium as an RX after i left the hospital.  It makes me dopey  by the 3rd dose in the early evening, but it keeps me so calm that even when I do think about drinking I feel calm enough to deal with the urges.  I am also taking Antabuse.  Something to consider if you need as much help as I do.

column2: Staster, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medication has allowed my anxiety to go down quite a bit.  I have no side effects

column2: painbegone, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Librium sucks. They should give it away free.  I've suffered from anxiety for decades and of all the treatments I've used to combat my anxiety including Valium, Xanax, Ativan and Librium, Librium is the only one that I found myself honestly questioning if the pharmacist gave me placebo's and kept the real stuff for themselves.

column2: alyoop, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Works fine in smaller doses. I would not start with a large dosage...did that yrs. ago and it slurred my speece. I use just 5 mg. when I get real upset about something or when my blood pressure is a bit elevated, and it controls both very well.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was taken off clonazapam abruptly..not weened off after taking if for 3 years.  Doc would not refill script..said it wasnt supposed to be for long term use...Is that my fault?  Had the shakes so bad I couldnt write or tie my shoes....I turned to alcohol to relieve some of the symtoms..it worked but I had to get drunk to make it happen...then doc put my on 25mg librium, 4 times a day for 3day..and 3 for 3 days...and so on..until gone.  As soon as I took that first pill the shakes stopped.  I dont know whats going to happen when Im weened off for good...maybe the shaking will come back...maybe it wont..but so far...so good.

librium really works and makes me feel like my old self. one issue is make sure you taper off of it. one doctor gave me 75mg of librium a day for two and a half weeks. not knowing anything about the medicine i ran out thinking it was no big deal. guess what happened next (i started drinking). after, i tapered of of librium one week and began taking antabuse. it was a good mix and a good solution. the librium significantly reduces my interest in drinking.

column2: EvetCp@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have colon cancer which cause severe diarrhea and makes me afraid to eat for three days at a time. This medication relieves the anxiety and fear so it is not only for alcohol withdrawal it calms the spasms in my colon so the other meds will help relieve the diarrhea.

column2: james, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i was hospitalized several times for acute pancreatites. at least 6 days each time. horrible withdrawls, even decked a nurse and was restrained. sorry. since ive been taking 25mg 3 times daily the mental craving, 18 or more beers a day is still there it really seems to keep the physical problems down even though ive got a long way to go.

column2: anonymous, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am on 10 mg every 12 hrs as needed--it works but makes me extremely sleepy.  It helps, but I only take it when I start having trouble with withdrawals.  I have been drinking daily for about 4 years.  Nothing takes away the main desire to NOT drink--it's something I've had to dig deep within to find.  I could drink a gallon right now but I'm determined not to.

column2: DC, 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: DROWSINESS ANXIETY

column2: Dave C, 25-34 Male  (Patient)
column9: This message is for all the Dr.s and nurses that work in detox facilities for alcoholics. Libriums does not work on patients craving for more alcohol, at least for me it did'nt. I recently went into a three day so-called " intensive" detox program from alcohol that cost about $6500. No matter what the cost, at least give the patient a medication strong enough to get their mind off of wanting another drink. It's bad enough we are unwilling addicts to a drug but least give us the right amount of help. They started off giving me 4 Libriums and vitamins. I've been an alcoholic for at least 20 years and stopping the shaking and making sure I get my vitamins A,B, and C isn't going to stop me from thinking about another beer or 3 or 12. In fact, the drugs were given to me in little paper cups that reminded me of shot glasses. I'm not telling you guys to give us meds for a buzz, but at least give us something to take our minds off of needing another drink.

column2: don j, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: worked well 4 detox;however, all my lowerextremeties joints are sore and it is hardto walk. I'm sure this will past in time.

column2: joanna Miller, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
bluebird day, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been described 3 types of drugs for serious alcohol withdrawls throughout the years (valium, xanax, and librium).  Librium by far been the best for treating withdrawls and the anxiety that goes along with it.  I was told by a psychiatrist at a treatment center specializing in alcohol addiction that it is the best for the symptoms of withdrawl and the safest as far its addictive properties.  I have been sober for 2 years now and hopefully won't have to go through alcohol withdrawls ever again.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Works very well for social anxiety.I take a very low dose a 1/2 hour before a social gathering. Gets me through the interactions with out having to drink alcohol to loosen up.

column9: After years of alcohol abuse I went into treatment and was on 300mg for a while and then gradually weened down off of it .The only thing I did not like was the feeling of not touching the ground while I was walking .Other than that I found it to be very helpful

column2: tripp, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it helps but dose not work

column2: STEROIDDEPENDENT, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: IN OCT OF 2006, I WAS PLACED UNDER A 72 HOUR SUICIDAL WATCH WHILE BEING ADMITTED FOR ALCOHOL DETOXING. I SPENT 5 DAYS IN A FACILITY WHILE TAKING 300MG OF LIBRUIM. WHEN LEAVING THIS FACILITY, THE DR. JUST DROPPED ME OFF THE MEDICATION WITHOUT SENDING ME HOME WITH ANY. THE NEXT DAY WHEN I DIDN'T TAKE THE DOSE, I HAD A MILD SEIZURE. I COULD NOT GET INTO SEE MY DR. FOR ANOTHER DAY. FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS, I WENT THROUGH HELL. I HAD SEIZURES, I WAS FALLING DOWN, I COULDN'T TALK, DIDN'T KNOW WHERE I WAS, HAD NO MOBILITY AT ALL. WHEN MY DR. PUT ME BACK ON IT FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS TO WHEIN ME OFF AGAIN, HE DID IT AT A LOW DOSE. I WENT TO SEE HIM ON A FRIDAY, AND ON MONDAY I WENT TO SEE ANOTHER DR. BECAUSE I WAS ALSO GIVEN ANABUSE. THESE DRUGS ARE KNOWN TO BE DOWNERS, AND I TAKE MEDICATIONS FOR OTHER CONDITIONS THAT ARE UPPERS. OVER THE WEEKEND I HAD ABOUT 4-6 SEIZURES A DAY. I REALLY WANTED TO DIE. THEY WHEINED ME OFF SLOWLY IN 2 WEEKS BECAUSE I WAS GOING TO A REHAB AND I COULD NOT BE ON ANY BENZO'S. WHILE IN REHAB I WAS SWITCHED TO SEROQUEL, AND IT WAS MUCH BETTER. ONLY ONCE I WAS GIVEN THE LIBRUIM IN REHAB, BUT IT WAS ONLY 100MG. I WAS HAVING A TERRIBLE PANIC ATTACK. I WILL NOT TAKE THIS DRUG EVER AGAIN.

column2: Milo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Librium after I requested to try something different from Klonopin. I didn't find this medicine as helpful as some of the other benzodiazepines. It works, but not in an outstanding way. My pharmacist at the time even asked me, "Does this stuff really work?" I requested to be changed to Ativan, which worked better for me. I was only taking 40 mg./day, so maybe that's why it didn't work as well for me as it has for some other people.

column2: Mike, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: good

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Used in doses up to 400mg/day for combat Post Traumatic Stress.  Now not available in brand name 25mg caps.  After initial high dose tapered down & use as needed.  Generic is bad.

column2: stillredhot, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I recently went to detox for 6 days for alcohol withdrawal.  They put me on Librium for 3 days and then continued vitamins for the rest of my stay.  I came out completely refreshed.  Librium took care of the shakes, nervousness, hallucinations and tremors. My doctor prescribed me 10 mg to have at home when needed for anxiety.

column2: jfas01@core.com, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Very effective in treating PTSD by large doses.  Least side effects of drugs tried. Generic is not as effective.  Binder disolves erraticaticly in generic. Brand name not available in 25mg.  Bad news for me.

column2: soberglenn, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is my fourth day on 300mg and my Dr is decreasing the dose slowly over the next 8-10 days.  I have been feeling much better but after 100mg tonight cant seem to get to sleep.  My major concern is can I overdose?  I did take an extra 25mg tonigh to try and get some sleep.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'VE BEEN ON THIS DRUG SINCE FEB. 2006. I STARTED AT TEN 25MG PILLS A DAY. WEANED DOWN TO TWO 25MG A DAY. HAVE NOTICED THAT IT CAN MAKE ME MORE IRRITABLE, LIKE THE ABOVE POSTER SAID. ANYONE WHO HAS HAD PROBLEMS WITH ANGER OR IRRITABILITY INCREASE ON LIBRIUM, PLEASE EMAIL ME kristennelsen@peoplepc.comMY DOCTOR SAYS IT IS AN ADDICTIVE DRUG---BUT ONLY IF I ABUSE IT---WHICH I DO NOT. I TRIED TO DETOX OFF OF 50MG A DAY AND ALMOST DIED, MY HEART WAS ON FIRE ACROSS MY CHEST. IT DOES NOT GIVE YOU A "HIGH" FEELING LIKE XANAX AND ATIVAN DID FOR ME, IT DECREASES MY ANXIETY WITHOUT ME EVEN KNOWING IT---WHICH MAKES IT A GOOD AND SAFE DRUG FOR ME.LIKE IT, BUT SCARED I WILL DEVELOP TOLERANCE ON IT.

column9: This helps with my anxiety, as well as a muscle relaxant.

column2: Richard, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take 19mg 3x per day along with 500mg depakote to control simple partial seizure and anxiety.  I like this drug very much because of the long half life and also because it is less potent than ativan, xanax, etc..  I never have had to increase the dosage.  It's cheap and works great.
